newsitem.title: JAPAN: Dollar dips below 113 yen, lowest since May 21.
newsitem.headline: Dollar dips below 113 yen, lowest since May 21.

text.p: The dollar fell below 113 yen in early Tokyo on Monday, its lowest level since May 21, traders said.
Speculative selling by domestic and overseas players dragged the dollar down in early trade, triggering stop-loss sales, dealers said.
"More panic sales by Japanese investors for hedge purposes could take the greenback further down," a city bank dealer said.
The U.S. currency closed at 114.33/43 yen on Friday in New York.
